name: Clove
climate: Clove plants thrive in a tropical climate with high humidity levels.
The ideal temperature range for clove is between 20°C and 30°C.
They do not tolerate frosty conditions and need a warm environment.
Cloves require a climate without extreme cold or scorching heat.
sunlight: Clove plants require full sunlight to partial shade for optimal growth.
They thrive best in areas where they receive at least six hours of sunlight.
In very hot climates, clove plants can benefit from afternoon shade.
Direct morning sunlight with some protection in the afternoon is ideal.
watering: Clove trees need well-distributed rainfall or regular watering to thrive.
The soil should be kept consistently moist but not waterlogged.
During dry spells, clove trees require deep watering to prevent stress.
Proper drainage is essential to prevent root rot and water stagnation.
soil: Clove trees prefer rich, loamy soil that is well-drained and fertile.
The soil should retain moisture while allowing excess water to drain.
Slightly acidic to neutral pH levels between 5.5 and 7 are optimal.
Avoid heavy clay soils that can retain too much water around the roots.
extra_care_tip: Prune clove trees regularly to maintain their shape and improve airflow.
Mulching around the base can help retain soil moisture and control weeds.
